data.title: old world charm and staff
data.text: superb staff.  very responsive and helpful.  Room with King and sitting area was exactly what we needed for a 1 night "stay-cation".  Car park location felt relatively guarded and the location of the hotel was exactly what we wanted for walking to any number of restaurants, bars, quick order and even a bakery.  Price was right and the time was good.

data.title: A wonderful surprise
data.text: We didn't know what to expect.  We found the lobby is up a flight of stairs.   But the building is charming.  The Otis elevator has a metal gate that you open & close to enter/exit.  The 5th floor open air patio was an unexpected treasure.  We carried in Lou Malnati's classic deep dish pizza and ate al fresco in the hidden patio area.  This is a charming hotel.  We will return!

data.title: Charm of a family-run hotel
data.text:
My recent status as handicapped made staying at an older hotel a bit of a challenge, but as I always prefer a boutique hotel to a chain, I chose the Margarita while the rest of the family--in for a wedding-- stayed elsewhere. Because of steps at the entrance, I called ahead and was given their back door code, and used the elevator from the basement, but as their (free) parking lot was in the rear, it was easy for my cabbie to drop me off and assist me.

Breakfast in the big salon was a treat. There were guests scattered all over the room in chairs and sofas. Coffee was robust. My room was charming, although a bit dark.  I would have preferred a brighter lamp. I wouldn't recommend this for business travel but for a weekend away, or perhaps a romantic getaway.

The location is ideal for Evanston--on a quiet street, but close enough that I was able to walk downtown with my walker to meet up with relatives for dining and shopping.

data.title: Surprising little hotel, AMAZING service
data.text: This is a small older hotel on a side street in Evanston. It is conveniently located to downtown, and remarkably, very easy street parking (there is evidently hotel parking as well, but street parking was always easy to find right in front of the hotel).  The hotel itself is probably approaching 100 years old and has loads of charm but is definitely a bit dated.  We stayed in a king room, which was quite small but there were plentiful outlets for charging devices, dark heavy curtains, very speedy free wifi, the bathroom had robes, and most importantly, a shower door rather than a shower curtain.    On this trip, we stayed in Evanston because of a family member was hospitalized there, and for perspective, we are hotel snobs and usually stay at the Four Seasons or the Peninsula when traveling to Chicago.  So with that in mind, this small tucked away little hotel had the BEST service we've ever experienced.  From the moment we walked in, they greeted us by name, and were attentive and accommodating throughout our stay.   The service was very personalized and  every staff person  we encountered throughout this stay went out of their way to offer assistance, anticipate our needs, and offer personalized attention.   Another thing that definitely deserves mention is the hotel "continental breakfast", which we normally skip but which in this case was superb.   They have a baker who bakes homemade croissants (incredible) and a variety of other pastries.  there was also  steel cut oatmeal (the real kind), and most notably, small batch Greek yogurt that was hands down the most amazing I've ever tasted (evidently, they import it from Canada?).  The hotel does not have a gym, but both Evanston Athletic Club and LA Fitness are just down the street, and day passes were $25 and $15 respectively.     Overall, this hotel was really quite refreshing and surprising and lovely, with outstanding service, and we would definitely stay there again.

data.title: Wonderful Inn
data.text: Went here for a romantic getaway.  It's absolutely lovely, old world charm, delicious breakfast, kind and helpful staff. The L is with in walking distance and its about a 30 to 40 minute ride to down town. The staff helped us learn the ropes of the train.  The breakfast is made by am real French Chef. The beds are super comfortable. Parking is cheap.

data.title: Great location & staff
data.text:
I stayed here 2 nights and highly recommend it.  I was able to check in early (flew to Midway, took an Uber to Margarita European Inn) which was unexpected.  Kathryn, the GM, was on duty to assist at check-in and a few other times when we needed suggestions and/or assistance to find places.  She's fabulous!

Breakfast is enough to make you full.  Maybe for the higher priced nights, the breakfast following could have more hot options.  Everything is in walking distance or you can easily walk to the train (which we did to get back to Chicago).  If taking train to Chicago, check schedule so you can take the express.

Location is in great neighborhood.  Hotel is older but clean.  Rooms/hallways are quiet (I never heard other ppl on my floor).  I'd easily stay again!

data.title: Another great stay in Evanston
data.text: Always a pleasure to stay at the Margarita European Inn when in Evanston visiting our daughter who is a student at Northwestern.  What brings us back is the outstanding personal service that Kathryn and her team provide.  We love the charm of the Inn, the breakfasts and the roof deck.  We sometimes buy a bottle of wine around the corner for our own personal happy hour in the living room or roof deck.  The Inn is full of charm and the breakfast is very good.  I usually have the homemade greek yogurt and a hard boiled egg with coffee.  There is an array of cereals and pastries that also look delicious.  And, easy parking in the back.  Good location for the university, shops and restaurants - 10 to 20 minutes depending on where you are going.  This year we took the train to Chicago and the Davis stop is right around the corner.  I highly recommend.

data.title: Quaint Hotel dropped in Evanston from Europe!
data.text:
I recently stayed 2 nights at the Margarita European Inn.  It is a 2 minute walk from either the Davis "L" line or Davis Metea station and is convenient to all of downtown Evanston.  

It has a lovely parlor,I which a very substantial continental breakfast is served, a wood paneled library, a roof top deck and an outdoor patio.

I had a lovely room that was quite large with very comfortable bedding and a well appointed bathroom.  The hotel is very quiet.  The only negative was the thermostat for the shower was broken,so the water temp, which was quite hot, could not be adjusted.  The management dealt with the matter correctly.

Would definitely consider staying here again.  Check out is 11am and check in is 2pm. I believe there is parking available for a additional fee.  The hotel reminds me of a by-gone time when there were family run institutions.

data.title: Great place
data.text: I have stayed here twice now and both times have been great stays. The parking can be a bit of an issue your first time around but the hotel, front desk staff and the rooms have been great. Keep in mind this is an old building and it is really neat how it's been modernized while still keeping to the rustic old building look and feel.

data.title: Good alternative to cookie-cutter hotel spaces....without sacrificing large modern bath and good wifi.
data.text:
I was familiar with this property having grown up in Evanston, and wanted to try it on a recent trip back.  Excellent choice as long as you understand there is "charm" - everything is not modern and perfect.  But the period furnishings, and breakfast creations of the pastry chef more than make up for it.  

After oversleeping Saturday morning I was afraid I had missed the breakfast hours.  I was delighted to find many pastries, fruit, cereals, juice and (good) coffee still out  an hour or so after "closing" time.  And the chef encouraged me to take as much as I would like - he seemed to really enjoy having people enjoy his food.  The parlor that breakfast is served in is huge with vintage couches, leather easy chairs, antique decorations, newspapers, and no blaring TV.  Wonderful!

THe room was nice.  I had the basic room so the room itself wasn't overly spacious, but the BATHROOM was HUGE!  Shower large enough for 2.  Pedestal sink.  Plenty of soft fluffy towels.  Lots of freebies.  Much nicer than I expected for this older property.  

Also, the BED was VERY COMFORTABLE, and had very nice linens and pillows of several firmnesses so there is sure to be one to suit you.

I should note that the elevator was out when I arrived, but  the desk clerk carried my bag up the 1 flight of stairs to my room.  The elevator is OLD but safe and quaint.  

I'll be back!

data.title: Hidden Gem in Evanston
data.text: My family stayed here for a football game in northern Chicago.  I discovered it when all of the more recognizable names were booked for the Labor Day weekend.  I had two teenagers and two 22 year olds for my room and then my parents needed a room too.  Not only did our room have plenty of room, everyone was incredibly comfortable.  The rooms have been redecorated and are quite charming.  The bathroom had two sinks and a large shower with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel in pumps on the wall rather than the very small samples most hotels give.  The staff were very helpful and made us feel like old friends.  Not to be missed is the continental breakfast in the salon, the library is wonderful, as is the outside patio and rooftop deck which has couches.  You are within walking distance for fabulous restaurants and bars.  My dad and I walked to downtown Sunday morning and there is a CVS.  We passed a station for the El so no need to drive downtown.  Will definitely stay again.

data.title: Camino reunion
data.text: Wonderful, cozy, friendly old world-feel inn.  The staff is warm and helpful, the rooms were spotless, the relaxing atmosphere a welcome respite.  Breakfast was delicious and a great place to visit and meet new people.  The roof top terrace has an amazing view of downtown Chicago.  We will come back.

data.title: Evanston's hidden gem!!
data.text: This is a truly hidden gem. The interior of the hotel dates back to an era of unbelievable classiness. The staff in the hotel are casually chatty and pleasant. The rooms also have some modern amenities like TVs. You won't believe this, but the reservation was for a room with one large bed and two bunk beds. Instead, they upgraded us for free. They gave us along with the room with a large bed an adjoining room with two other beds. Again: it was free. The rooms were very accommodating for the four people in my family. The elevator was very old fashioned, and cool looking. They were doing work on it the second day of the trip, so I was glad I got to ride in it the first day. They even gave us free wifi, free breakfast buffet, and a sun deck on the ceiling. There's even a really old but still nice library with books you can read during your stay for free. See, ordinary these days major hotel brands can really stack on the fees. This place is privately owned and doesn't do that. They genuinely seem to care more about your experience than their profits. The money it costed for this incredibly classy place was incredibly low. Yeah, this place gets it right. If you're around Evanston, you'd be a fool to opt for another hotel. Even if you're in Chicago, you can see the skyline from the sun deck on the top floor, so it's not that far away. The hotel clientele international. Very classy people stay here. I was glad to be one of them.

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: Stayed one night on a road trip. Beautiful property from a bygone era. Updated modern rooms with all of the conveniences but charm of the 20's. The elevator will rocket you to your floor with no wait. Linens and amenities are super nice. All staff I interacted with was very nice.  I wanted to steal the beautiful tapestry bed spread but I refrained. Hats off to Margarita European Inn!

data.title: Don't Judge a Book by Its Cover
data.text: I reserved a room for the evening of June 27, 2016 based upon online advertising by this hotel. It looked very nice, a traditional European feel, but clean and updated. Upon arrival I was greeted by a musty smell in the lobby, which was quite old and run down in appearance. I asked to see my room and was taken on an equally old and creaking elevator to a room that was not at all as advertised online. Very small, clean, but antiquated. When I informed the desk clerk that I would not be staying he refused to cancel the reservation (because it was not done 24 hours in advance) and I had to dispute it with my credit card company.

data.title: Lovely visit
data.text: Very cute boutique hotel which was still quite close to downtown Chicago.   Me and my family are on a cross the USA roadtrip and stumbled across this place by surprise.  Elevator is very small and old, but it still did the job for me and my family.  Next time we visit Chicago, we would definitely try to stay here again.  Loved free parking! ! !

data.title: Fabulous!!!
data.text: We came to chicago to watch the cubs play baseball. Chose this hotel as part of choice hotels and had no clue the excitement we would experience at this hotel. I have to say this historic hotel is by far one of the greatest of have stayed in. Antique furniture, woodwork, and the history is astonishing. The French pastry chef, management, front desk attendants and super help and info from Kathryn Weimer made our visit memorable. Will definately return.

data.title: Quaint, convenient, and comfortable
data.text: This was a wonderful establishment that has an intersting history to it. The rooms are comfortable and the bathroom was modern with complementary q-tips and cotton balls. It even had bathrobes! But that was just the start. The breakfast consisted of wonderful pastries made by their French chef daily (and personally I ate way more than I should have). The breakfast is served in their parlor and is unique in a good way. Plus, their quaint old style elevator is a must see/ride. 5 stars will absolutely stay here again if I have to come to the Chicago area.

data.title: Nice Amenities with a Charming European Experience
data.text:
We booked the Margarita Inn for 3 nights, but ended up staying for only two.  The management was very nice about us leaving early. There's a lovely rooftop lounge area, a great old elevator, and fabulous continental breakfast with wonderful home made pastries, greek yogurt, hard boiled eggs and steel cut oatmeal. The tea selection could have been higher-end, but I'm a tea-snob. 
The Margarita is convenient to the "L" train into Chicago and to Northwestern University.  It's perfect for a couple, but like many European hotels, our room was small - especially for a family of four. The picture of the Queen-Twin-Twin bed on the website showed bunk beds, but we had trundles, which made for cramped quarters. So, my advice is that if you're traveling with a family, call to ask directly about the room layout. Otherwise, it was terrific.

data.title: Great stay at a European style Bed and Breakfast
data.text: I don't normally take the time to review my stays but this one was worth the time.  Super comfy beds and linens, nice baths, and furnished very nicely.  The building has a lot of history and they have preserved it nicely.  The lounge, library, patio, and rooftop lounge were very nice and inviting.  The breakfast was excellent and all service was exceptional and had a personal touch of a small bed and breakfast.  Location was quiet but blocks from downtown Evanston and 30 - 45 minutes from down town Chicago or airport.  Very family friendly too.  Great Stay!
